choices: Settlers from Arab Countries constitute a significant fraction of Kenya’s population today.
Cushitic speaking people moved into today’s Kenyan territory around 2000 years ago.
Arab traders started paying regular visits to Kenya ever since the turn of the Common Era.
The Kenyan coast has over the centuries served host to diverse communities and cultures.

question: Which of the following statements is not true with reference to Kenya?

text: It is believed that Cushitic-speaking people were the first ethnic group to migrate to today’s Kenya. It is believed that they moved in from northern Africa somewhere around 2000 BCE. Then came the Arab Traders who started frequenting the Kenyan coast way back in the first century CE (Common Era). The Kenyan coast served host to communities of iron workers, subsistence farmers, hunters and fishermen who supported the economy with agriculture, fishing, metal production and trade with foreign countries.
